issue.title: Unwanted deletion of the note
issue.body:
## Story

I had a note, created on Joplin Android. On Joplin Desktop, I decided I do not need this anymore and deleted it.
After that day, I forgot that I deleted this because it was still on Android. I worked all the day and put results into this note on Android. The next day on Android, synchronization started and deleted my local note without sending it to the syncing target.

## Environment

Joplin version: Android (2.12.3), Linux (2.12.19)
Platform: Android, Linux, Joplin Cloud
OS specifics: Android 14, Linux EndeavourOS

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create note on Android. 
2. Sync with target on Android. 
3. Sync with target on Desktop. 
4. Delete note on Desktop.
5. Work with note on Android. 
6. Sync with target on Android. 
7. Note with all work deleted without syncing.

## Describe what you expected to happen

If there is the deletion of the note on the sync target, but on the local device we have this note with more recent changes - do not delete the note on the local device and send it to the sync target.

An additional question is why it wasn't synchronization for the whole day of working with notes on an Android device.

## Logfile

[syncReport-1698392418955.txt](https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/files/13186312/syncReport-1698392418955.txt)

## P.S.

If there is a chance to restore my work from Android in some way - please tell me. The job I have done is not repeatable.
`27T09:16:02,30,"Synchronizer: ""Sync: deleteLocal: remote has been deleted: Note: (Local 532c4befe2e64174b63a39927e4737bb): (Remote 532c4befe2e64174b63a39927e4737bb.md)""`

comment.body: The note history would have been transferred to the desktop app via sync, so you can try from there

commits.message: @marcorombach has signed the CLA in laurent22/joplin#9150

issue.title: Server: Added ldap authentication
issue.body:
This provides the option to use up to two LDAP directories as authentication source for Joplin Server.
If activated user also will be created on the fly if LDAP authentication was successful.
The mail address is used to search the user in the directories.

Following ENV variables are available to configure the LDAP authentication:

```
LDAP_1_ENABLED: false,
LDAP_1_CREATE_USER: true,
LDAP_1_SERVER: '', // ldap server in following format ldap(s)://servername:port
LDAP_1_MAIL_ATTRIBUTE: 'mail',
LDAP_1_FULLNAME_ATTRIBUTE: 'displayName',
LDAP_1_BASE_DN: '',
LDAP_1_BIND_DN: '', // used for user search - leave empty if ldap server allows anonymous bind
LDAP_1_BIND_PW: '', // used for user search - leave empty if ldap server allows anonymous bind
```

For a second LDAP server just replace 1 with 2 in the variable name.
BIND_DN and BIND_PW are optional - if not provided, a anonymous bind against the LDAP server will be tried.
MAIL_ATTRIBUTE and FULLNAME_ATTRIBUTE may vary for different LDAP servers, the preset values works for ActiveDirectory.

comment.body: I have read the CLA Document and I hereby sign the CLA

issue.body:
This provides the option to use up to two LDAP directories as authentication source for Joplin Server.
If activated user also will be created on the fly if LDAP authentication was successful.
The mail address is used to search the user in the directories.

Following ENV variables are available to configure the LDAP authentication:

```

LDAP_1_MAIL_ATTRIBUTE: 'mail',
```

For a second LDAP server just replace 1 with 2 in the variable name.

pull_request.title: Server: Added ldap authentication
pull_request.body:
This provides the option to use up to two LDAP directories as authentication source for Joplin Server.
If activated user also will be created on the fly if LDAP authentication was successful.
The mail address is used to search the user in the directories.

Following ENV variables are available to configure the LDAP authentication:

```
LDAP_1_ENABLED: false,
LDAP_1_CREATE_USER: true,
LDAP_1_SERVER: '', // ldap server in following format ldap(s)://servername:port
LDAP_1_MAIL_ATTRIBUTE: 'mail',
LDAP_1_FULLNAME_ATTRIBUTE: 'displayName',
LDAP_1_BASE_DN: '',
LDAP_1_BIND_DN: '', // used for user search - leave empty if ldap server allows anonymous bind
LDAP_1_BIND_PW: '', // used for user search - leave empty if ldap server allows anonymous bind
```

For a second LDAP server just replace 1 with 2 in the variable name.
BIND_DN and BIND_PW are optional - if not provided, a anonymous bind against the LDAP server will be tried.
MAIL_ATTRIBUTE and FULLNAME_ATTRIBUTE may vary for different LDAP servers, the preset values works for ActiveDirectory.

issue.title: Unwanted deletion of the note
issue.body:
## Story

I had a note, created on Joplin Android. On Joplin Desktop, I decided I do not need this anymore and deleted it.
After that day, I forgot that I deleted this because it was still on Android. I worked all the day and put results into this note on Android. The next day on Android, synchronization started and deleted my local note without sending it to the syncing target.

## Environment

Joplin version: Android (2.12.3), Linux (2.12.19)
Platform: Android, Linux, Joplin Cloud
OS specifics: Android 14, Linux EndeavourOS

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create note on Android. 
2. Sync with target on Android. 
3. Sync with target on Desktop. 
4. Delete note on Desktop.
5. Work with note on Android. 
6. Sync with target on Android. 
7. Note with all work deleted without syncing.

## Describe what you expected to happen

If there is the deletion of the note on the sync target, but on the local device we have this note with more recent changes - do not delete the note on the local device and send it to the sync target.

An additional question is why it wasn't synchronization for the whole day of working with notes on an Android device.

## Logfile

[syncReport-1698392418955.txt](https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/files/13186312/syncReport-1698392418955.txt)

## P.S.

If there is a chance to restore my work from Android in some way - please tell me. The job I have done is not repeatable.
`27T09:16:02,30,"Synchronizer: ""Sync: deleteLocal: remote has been deleted: Note: (Local 532c4befe2e64174b63a39927e4737bb): (Remote 532c4befe2e64174b63a39927e4737bb.md)""`

comment.body:
> but it's not sure

Yes, I saw this thread. But do we have a command pallet on Android Joplin? As a side note, I do not have root on the phone to reach DB itself.

Actually, I opened the issue not for the purpose of restoring this note (it would be good if we can, of course), but for preventing this from happening further. As I understood, there is no check on timestamps of last changes when a note is deleted locally.

issue.title: Disable generation of blockmap and mac.zip files during release
issue.body:
Regression probably caused by this commit: 050d9fa7945903a449652b1c527fdbb43db1ae0b

More info: https://github.com/electron-userland/electron-builder/issues/7242#issuecomment-1308153986

> The note should be in the Conflict folder

No, it wasn't put into the Conflict folder. As you can see by sync report in "P.S." the note was just deleted.

issue.title: Toolbar icons in view mode are partly not grayed out and can be used
issue.body:
<!--
  Please provide a clear and concise description of what the bug is. (In the section Steps To Reproduce.)
  Include screenshots for UI problems if needed.
  DO NOT create screenshots of text !!! Copy and paste the text into a code block.
  Please test using the latest Joplin release to make sure your issue has not already been fixed.
-->

<!--
  IMPORTANT: If you are reporting a clipper bug, please include an example URL that shows the issue.
  Without the URL the issue is likely to be closed.
-->

## Environment

Joplin version: 2.12.19
Platform: Windows, Linux
OS specifics: Win 10, OpenSUSE

<!--
  Platform can be one of: macOS, Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, terminal (or a combination)
  OS specifics: e.g. OS version, Linux distribution, Android/iOS version...
-->

## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a note
2. Switch to view mode
3. Press B from the toolbar icons

Because the icons B, I and so on can be used even in view mode in the case of pressing the B button the text **strong text** will be inserted in the note at the place the cursor has been during edit mode. 

<!--
  Issues without reproduction steps are likely to stall.
-->

## Describe what you expected to happen

Either all of the markdown editor buttons should be grayed out or the toolbar should be hidden at all.

Additional note: For me it would not be a problem when the navigation arrows in the toolbar would be used for undo and redo instead for navigation. If this would be the case I think it would not be a problem to hide the toolbar in view mode at all.

## Logfile

<!--
  Please attach a debug log. Issues without a debug log are likely to stall.
  For information on how to collect a log file: https://joplinapp.org/debugging/
-->
![Toolbar icons in view mode are partly not grayed out and can be used](https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/assets/19151189/8ae0ca27-f116-487d-a6e0-b64a56eba4cd)

issue.title: .svgz images aren't displayed

labels.name: stale
labels.description: An issue that hasn't been active for a while...

issue.body:
<!--
  Please provide a clear and concise description of what the bug is. (In the section Steps To Reproduce.)
  Include screenshots for UI problems if needed.
  DO NOT create screenshots of text !!! Copy and paste the text into a code block.
  Please test using the latest Joplin release to make sure your issue has not already been fixed.
-->

<!--
  IMPORTANT: If you are reporting a clipper bug, please include an example URL that shows the issue.
  Without the URL the issue is likely to be closed.
-->

## Environment

Joplin version: 2.11, 5d87b4ca3e3fcae6fa96b080d24e80f8f691edbc
Platform: Android, desktop, **edit:** and iOS
OS specifics: Android 14 emulator, Ubuntu 23.04

<!--
  Platform can be one of: macOS, Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, terminal (or a combination)
  OS specifics: e.g. OS version, Linux distribution, Android/iOS version...
-->

## Steps to reproduce

1. GZip an SVG image and rename it to `svgz`
2. Attach the SVG image to a note as an image.

<!--
  Issues without reproduction steps are likely to stall.
-->

## Describe what you expected to happen

The SVGZ image should be displayed.


## Screenshot

![Joplin note in markdown editor mode. An SVGZ file is attached and not displaying.](https://github.com/laurent22/joplin/assets/46334387/aba5c194-1130-4afc-aecc-6bc0e0b39534)

## See also 
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SVG#Compression
- https://github.com/personalizedrefrigerator/joplin-plugin-freehand-drawing/issues/3

<!--
  Please attach a debug log. Issues without a debug log are likely to stall.
  For information on how to collect a log file: https://joplinapp.org/debugging/
-->

issue.title: Fix typos in translations (PL)
issue.body:
Hi!

I found some typos in the Polish translation. This PR fixes them :)

comment.body:
Hmm, it seems that you directly changed the file. 

You are supposed to use Poedit, otherwise unwanted errors can occur. e.g. you changed a "fuzzy" translation, which will never be used, becaused it has the status "fuzzy".
If you had used poedit, you would have seen it flagged as fuzzy and after translating it, it would have been a valid entry.

I will run the workflow, but please use poedit. As mentioned before, your translations of the strings marked as fuzzy won't be used.
